body.name: DNYN Full XL Over Queen Bunk Bed with Ladder & Safety Guardrails for Kids and Adult,Convertible Metal Bedframe,No Box Spring Needed & Space Saving Design,Perfect for Dorm,Bedroom,Guest Room, White
features: [Contemporary Build] The simple yet contemporary bunk bed is a modern classic, featuring a streamlined iron-crafted frame complimented by an eye-catching chrome finish.It will be well matched with your home decor.

[Crafted For Safety] Designed with safety in mind, this bunk bed has a weight capacity of up to 250 pounds on top and 350 on the bottom that can handle multiple people at once, while also including full length gridded guardrails that run alongside the upper perimeter.

[Save Space or Split Into 2 Beds] An ideal space-saver and a perfect addition for a growing family, the bunk bed efficiently accommodates little ones, and young teens, allowing them the freedom and space to host friends and also offering a sleeping solution for younger sibling that share bedroom space - split the single bunk into two individual beds with ease if you move into a bigger home or your needs change.

[Easy Assembly]The bunk bed is delivered in one package, along with the installation manual and full set of hardware necessary to guide you through the process of assembly, and the bed will definitely be assembled conveniently.
[Dimensions] Overall Product Dimension: 83"L x62.6"W x65.3"H. Mattress is not included. Some assembly is required, although we have provided clear instructions and tools.
body.description: ❥ The simple yet contemporary bunk bed is a modern classic, featuring a streamlined iron-crafted frame complimented by an eye-catching chrome finish. ❥ ❥ Manufactured with support you can rely on, the bunk bed is constructed with a sturdy Quality Tested iron frame that eliminates excess wobbling while adding solid stability and durability allowing users to sleep soundly. ❥ ❥ An ideal space-saver and a perfect addition for a growing family, the bunk bed efficiently accommodates little ones, and young teens, allowing them the freedom and space to host friends.This bunk bed will be a beautiful and practical piece in your bedroom. ❥ Weight & Dimensions ❥ Overall Product Dimension:83"L x62.6"W x65.3"H❥ ❥ Detail Product Dimension:Please refer to the Size image ❥ ❥ Number of Package:1 ❥ ❥ Package Dimension:Please refer to the Specification ❥ ❥ Overall Product Weight:103.6 LBS ❥ ❥ Package Weight:Please refer to the Specification ❥ ❥ Weight Capacity: ❥ ❥ Upper Bed:250lbs ❥ ❥ Bottom Bed:350lbs ❥ ❥ Recommended Mattress Thickness: ❥ ❥ Upper Bed:6 inch Max ❥ ❥ Bottom Bed:8 inch ❥ ❥ Recommended age>6 years old ❥ ❥ Specifications ❥ ❥ Product Type:Bunk Bed ❥ ❥ Size:Full over Queen ❥ ❥ Color:White ❥ ❥ Material:Iron ❥ ❥ The number of slats:22pcs+22pcs ❥ ❥ Assembly Required:Yes ❥ ❥ Country of Origin:Vietnam ❥

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Difficult to assemble and not sturdy
reviews.reviewText: The bed took me a whole day to assemble. Beware it is Full XL and not a standard full size on top. After assembling it is apparent that the joints aren’t stiff enough to prevent the bed from wobbling when the person on top is moving.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Beware of sticker!
reviews.reviewText: Convinced my husband to get this so we wouldn’t have to get rid of our nice queen mattress after upgrading to a king (already had a full mattress for our son).The bed feels pretty sturdy for kids to use with no concern, which is the most important factor to consider for bunk beds in my opinion. Husband assembled the bed on his own in about an hour so nothing too complicated, but an extra set of hands is needed every once in a while to hold certain pieces up for tightening (and probably to put the full bed on top!).My only complaint… there were safety warning stickers on a piece that was a PAIN in the bootyhole to try and remove. Unfortunately, we did not have any googone so I tried water/soap, acetone, vinegar, clorox wipes, all my sponges to no avail. In desperation (and frustration) my husband went and sanded it down LOL… which was dumb on our part because yes, it got rid of the ugly sticky parts but also stripped the paint off. Slightly upset about it and will probably need to paint over it to avoid rusting and stuff but oh well.Would be much better if the manufacturer used those easy to peel stickers instead, but since that is unlikely, make sure you have some googone available before assembling!
